org.myrobotlab.client
Class MRLClient

java.lang.Object
  org.myrobotlab.client.MRLClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Receiver
public class MRLClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements Receiver

MRLClient class used to interface with a remote running instance or MyRobotLab. The instance of MRL must be running a RemoteAdapter service. This class can send and recieve messages from the MRL instance using only a few methods. The following code is an example of creating a client, registering a MRL instance, sending a subscribe message to a TestCatcher service named "catcher01". Whenever catcher01's catchInteger method is invoked a message will be sent back to the MRL client. And finally a "send" which sends a message to trigger the callback event. Example Code: MRLClient api = new MRLClient(); Receiver client = new Receiver(); api.register("localhost", 6767, client); api.subscribe("catchInteger", "catcher01", "myMsg", Integer.TYPE); api.send("catcher01", "catchInteger", 5);

register

public final boolean register(java.lang.String host,
                              int port,
                              Receiver client)
method which registers with a running MRL instance. It does this by sending a service directory update to the MRL's RemoteAdapter. From MRL's perspective it will appear as if this is another MRL instance with a single service. The bogus service name is controlled by overriding Receiver.getName() Once a MRLClient registers is may send messages and subscribe to events.

Parameters:
host - - target host or ip of the running MRL instance's RemoteAdapter
port - - target port of the RemoteAdapter
client - - call back interface to receive messages
Returns:

send

public final boolean send(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String method,
                          java.lang.Object... data)
method to send a messages to a running MRL instances. @see register(String, int, Receiver) must be called before "send" can be used.

Parameters:
name - - name of the service to receive the message (message destination)
method - - method to invoke
data - - parameter data for the method
Returns:

subscribe

public void subscribe(java.lang.String outMethod,
                      java.lang.String serviceName,
                      java.lang.String inMethod,
                      java.lang.Class<?>... paramTypes)
Subscribes to a remote MRL service method. When the method is called on the remote system an event message with return data is sent. It is necessary to registerForServices before subscribing.

Parameters:
outMethod - - the name of the remote method to hook/subscribe to
serviceName - - service name of the remote service
inMethod - - inMethod can be used as an identifier
paramTypes -
